verses.verse: And if a soul <S%H5315><s%> sin <S%H2398><s%>, and hear <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of swearing <S%H423><s%>, and is a witness <S%H5707><s%>, whether <S%H176><s%> he hath seen <S%H7200><s%> or known <S%H3045><s%> of it; if he do not utter <S%H5046><s%> it, then he shall bear <S%H5375><s%> his iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.

Or if a soul <S%H5315><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> any unclean <S%H2931><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>, whether it be a carcase <S%H5038><s%> of an unclean <S%H2931><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%>, or a carcase <S%H5038><s%> of unclean <S%H2931><s%> cattle <S%H929><s%>, or the carcase <S%H5038><s%> of unclean <S%H2931><s%> creeping things <S%H8318><s%>, and if it be hidden <S%H5956><s%> from him; he also shall be unclean <S%H2931><s%>, and guilty <S%H816><s%>.

Or if he touch <S%H5060><s%> the uncleanness <S%H2932><s%> of man <S%H120><s%>, whatsoever uncleanness <S%H2932><s%> it be that a man shall be defiled <S%H2930><s%> withal, and it be hid <S%H5956><s%> from him; when he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> of it, then he shall be guilty <S%H816><s%>.

Or if a soul <S%H5315><s%> swear <S%H7650><s%>, pronouncing <S%H981><s%> with his lips <S%H8193><s%> to do evil <S%H7489><s%>, or to do good <S%H3190><s%>, whatsoever it be that a man <S%H120><s%> shall pronounce <S%H981><s%> with an oath <S%H7621><s%>, and it be hid <S%H5956><s%> from him; when he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> of it, then he shall be guilty <S%H816><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these.
And it shall be, when he shall be guilty <S%H816><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these things, that he shall confess <S%H3034><s%> that he hath sinned <S%H2398><s%> in that thing:

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> his trespass offering <S%H817><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> for his sin <S%H2403><s%> which he hath sinned <S%H2398><s%>, a female <S%H5347><s%> from the flock <S%H6629><s%>, a lamb <S%H3776><s%> or a kid <S%H8166><s%> of the goats <S%H5795><s%>, for a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>; and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him concerning his sin <S%H2403><s%>.

And if he <S%H3027><s%> be not able <S%H1767><s%> to bring <S%H5060><s%> a lamb <S%H7716><s%>, then he shall bring <S%H935><s%> for <S%H854><s%> his trespass <S%H817><s%>, which he hath committed <S%H2398><s%>, two <S%H8147><s%> turtledoves <S%H8449><s%>, or two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons <S%H3123><s%>, unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; one <S%H259><s%> for a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>, and the other <S%H259><s%> for a burnt offering <S%H5930><s%>. he be: Heb. his hand cannot reach to the sufficiency of a lamb

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> them unto the priest <S%H3548><s%>, who shall offer <S%H7126><s%> that which is for the sin offering <S%H2403><s%> first <S%H7223><s%>, and wring off <S%H4454><s%> his head <S%H7218><s%> from <S%H4136><s%> his neck <S%H6203><s%>, but shall not divide it asunder <S%H914><s%>:

And he shall sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the sin offering <S%H2403><s%> upon the side <S%H7023><s%> of the altar <S%H4196><s%>; and the rest <S%H7604><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> shall be wrung out <S%H4680><s%> at the bottom <S%H3247><s%> of the altar <S%H4196><s%>: it is a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>.

And he shall offer <S%H6213><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> for a burnt offering <S%H5930><s%>, according to the manner <S%H4941><s%>: and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him for his sin <S%H2403><s%> which he hath sinned <S%H2398><s%>, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him. manner: or, ordinance

But if he <S%H3027><s%> be not able to bring <S%H5381><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> turtledoves <S%H8449><s%>, or two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons <S%H3123><s%>, then he that sinned <S%H2398><s%> shall bring <S%H935><s%> for his offering <S%H7133><s%> the tenth <S%H6224><s%> part of an ephah <S%H374><s%> of fine flour <S%H5560><s%> for a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>; he shall put <S%H7760><s%> no oil <S%H8081><s%> upon it, neither shall he put <S%H5414><s%> any frankincense <S%H3828><s%> thereon: for it is a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>.

Then shall he bring <S%H935><s%> it to the priest <S%H3548><s%>, and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall take <S%H7061><s%> his handful <S%H4393><s%> <S%H7062><s%> of it, even a memorial <S%H234><s%> thereof, and burn <S%H6999><s%> it on the altar <S%H4196><s%>, according to the offerings made by fire <S%H801><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>: it is a sin offering <S%H2403><s%>.

And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him as touching his sin <S%H2403><s%> that he hath sinned <S%H2398><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him: and the remnant shall be the priest's <S%H3548><s%>, as a meat offering <S%H4503><s%>.
And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> spake <S%H1696><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

If a soul <S%H5315><s%> commit <S%H4603><s%> a trespass <S%H4604><s%>, and sin <S%H2398><s%> through ignorance <S%H7684><s%>, in the holy things <S%H6944><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; then he shall bring <S%H935><s%> for his trespass <S%H817><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> a ram <S%H352><s%> without blemish <S%H8549><s%> out of the flocks <S%H6629><s%>, with thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> by shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>, after the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%>, for a trespass offering <S%H817><s%>:

And he shall make amends <S%H7999><s%> for the harm <S%H2398><s%> that he hath done in the holy thing <S%H6944><s%>, and shall add <S%H3254><s%> the fifth part <S%H2549><s%> thereto, and give <S%H5414><s%> it unto the priest <S%H3548><s%>: and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him with the ram <S%H352><s%> of the trespass offering <S%H817><s%>, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him.

And if a soul <S%H5315><s%> sin <S%H2398><s%>, and commit <S%H6213><s%> any <S%H259><s%> of these things which are forbidden to be done <S%H6213><s%> by the commandments <S%H4687><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; though he wist <S%H3045><s%> it not, yet is he guilty <S%H816><s%>, and shall bear <S%H5375><s%> his iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> a ram <S%H352><s%> without blemish <S%H8549><s%> out of the flock <S%H6629><s%>, with thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>, for a trespass offering <S%H817><s%>, unto the priest <S%H3548><s%>: and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him concerning his ignorance <S%H7684><s%> wherein he erred <S%H7683><s%> and wist <S%H3045><s%> it not, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him.
It is a trespass offering <S%H817><s%>: he hath certainly <S%H816><s%> trespassed <S%H816><s%> against the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
